content:
TITLE: Basic BrowserStack Configuration JSON Example
DESCRIPTION: Sample configuration file showing the basic structure of browserstack.json, including authentication, test framework, test paths, server port, and browser configurations for both desktop and mobile testing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/browserstack-runner/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "username": "<username>",
  "key": "<access key>",
  "test_framework": "qunit|jasmine|jasmine2|mocha",
  "test_path": ["relative/path/to/test/page1", "relative/path/to/test/page2"],
  "test_server_port": "8899",
  "browsers": [
    {
      "browser": "ie",
      "browser_version": "10.0",
      "device": null,
      "os": "Windows",
      "os_version": "8",
      "cli_key": 1
    },
    {
      "os": "android",
      "os_version": "4.0",
      "device": "Samsung Galaxy Nexus",
      "cli_key": 2
    },
    {
      "os": "ios",
      "os_version": "7.0",
      "device": "iPhone 5S",
      "cli_key": 3
    }
  ]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing and Running BrowserStack Runner via NPM
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install BrowserStack Runner globally or locally and run tests through the command line interface.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/browserstack-runner/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm -g install browserstack-runner
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
browserstack-runner
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install browserstack-runner
node_modules/.bin/browserstack-runner
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm -g config set user [user]
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
browserstack_runner --browsers 1 2 3 --path 'path/to/test/runner' --pid 'path/to/pid/file' -v
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using BrowserStack Runner as a Node.js Module
DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code example showing how to use BrowserStack Runner programmatically as a module in a Node.js application. It demonstrates initialization, configuration loading, and handling of test reports.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/browserstack-runner/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
var browserstackRunner = require("browserstack-runner");

var config = require("./browserstack.json");

browserstackRunner.run(config, function(error, report) {
  if (error) {
    console.log("Error:" + error);
    return;
  }
  console.log(JSON.stringify(report, null, 2));
  console.log("Test Finished");
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running BrowserStack Runner Tests
DESCRIPTION: Commands for executing BrowserStack Runner test suites, including both standard tests and extended compatibility tests for QUnit, Mocha, and Spine repositories.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/browserstack-runner/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm test
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run test-ci
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: BrowserStack Runner Init Command
DESCRIPTION: Command to initialize a browserstack.json configuration file in the project's root directory, with optional preset and path parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/browserstack-runner/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
browserstack-runner init [preset] [path]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Browser Configuration Examples for Desktop Testing
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration examples showing how to specify a desktop browser for testing on BrowserStack, with required parameters for platform, version and the optional cli_key for command line reference.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/browserstack-runner/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "browser": "ie",
  "browser_version": "10.0",
  "os": "Windows",
  "os_version": "8",
  "cli_key": 1
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Browser Configuration Examples for Mobile Testing
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration examples showing how to specify mobile browsers for testing on BrowserStack, with required parameters for mobile operating systems, versions, and devices.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/browserstack-runner/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
[
  {
    "os": "ios",
    "os_version": "8.3",
    "device": "iPhone 6 Plus",
    "cli_key": 1
  },
  {
    "os": "android",
    "os_version": "4.0",
    "device": "Google Nexus",
    "cli_key": 2
  }
]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Compact Browser Configuration Example
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration showing the compact syntax for browser specifications, using shortcuts like browser_current, browser_latest, browser_previous, and specific version notations mixed with fine-grained configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/browserstack-runner/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "browsers": [
    "chrome_previous",
    "chrome_latest",
    "firefox_previous",
    "firefox_latest",
    "ie_6",
    "ie_11",
    "opera_12_1",
    "safari_5_1",
    {
      "browser": "ie",
      "browser_version": "10.0",
      "device": null,
      "os": "Windows",
      "os_version": "8",
      "cli_key": 1
    }
  ]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sample Test Report Structure
DESCRIPTION: Example JSON structure of the test report object returned by the browserstackRunner.run method. It includes browser information, test details, assertions, and test suite results.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/browserstack-runner/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
[
  {
    "browser": "Windows 7, Firefox 47.0",
    "tests": [
      {
        "name": "isOdd()",
        "suiteName": "Odd Tests",
        "fullName": ["Odd Tests", "isOdd()"],
        "status": "passed",
        "runtime": 2,
        "errors": [],
        "assertions": [
          {
            "passed": true,
            "actual": true,
            "expected": true,
            "message": "One is an odd number"
          },
          {
            "passed": true,
            "actual": true,
            "expected": true,
            "message": "Three is an odd number"
          },
          {
            "passed": true,
            "actual": true,
            "expected": true,
            "message": "Zero is not odd number"
          }
        ]
      }
    ],
    "suites": {
      "fullName": [],
      "childSuites": [
        {
          "name": "Odd Tests",
          "fullName": ["Odd Tests"],
          "childSuites": [],
          "tests": [
            {
              "name": "isOdd()",
              "suiteName": "Odd Tests",
              "fullName": ["Odd Tests", "isOdd()"],
              "status": "passed",
              "runtime": 2,
              "errors": [],
              "assertions": [
                {
                  "passed": true,
                  "actual": true,
                  "expected": true,
                  "message": "One is an odd number"
                },
                {
                  "passed": true,
                  "actual": true,
                  "expected": true,
                  "message": "Three is an odd number"
                },
                {
                  "passed": true,
                  "actual": true,
                  "expected": true,
                  "message": "Zero is not odd number"
                }
              ]
            }
          ],
          "status": "passed",
          "testCounts": {
            "passed": 1,
            "failed": 0,
            "skipped": 0,
            "total": 1
          },
          "runtime": 2
        }
      ],
      "tests": [],
      "status": "passed",
      "testCounts": {
        "passed": 1,
        "failed": 0,
        "skipped": 0,
        "total": 1
      },
      "runtime": 2
    }
  }
]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Proxy Configuration for BrowserStack Local
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration example for setting up proxy support with BrowserStack local testing, specifying host, port, username, and password parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/browserstack-runner/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "proxy": {
    "host": "localhost",
    "port": 3128,
    "username": "foo",
    "password": "bar"
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for BrowserStack Runner Development
DESCRIPTION: Command for installing the required dependencies before contributing to the BrowserStack Runner project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/browserstack-runner/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Tests for BrowserStack Runner
DESCRIPTION: Command for running unit tests and linting tools to validate changes before submitting a pull request.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/browserstack-runner/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm test
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using npm-link to Test Local BrowserStack Runner Changes
DESCRIPTION: Commands to create a symlink between your local BrowserStack Runner checkout and another project to test your changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/browserstack-runner/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# in your browserstack-runner checkout
npm link
# in your project
npm link browserstack-runner
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing BrowserStack Runner From Local Path
DESCRIPTION: Alternative approach to test local changes by installing the BrowserStack Runner directly from a local path.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/browserstack-runner/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# in your project
npm install /path/to/checkout/browserstack-runner
```
